title: China floods: 30 killed in Beijing after days of heavy rain
description: Authorities in China's capital have relocated 80,000 people as more rain is forecast for Tuesday.
content:
Flood came 'so fast and suddenly'
Image source, Reuters
A resident in Miyun, a suburban district in Beijing, told AFP that he watched as floodwaters swept away vehicles outside his apartment on Monday morning.
People and a pet dog were lifted to safe... [468 chars]

title: Suspect in fatal shooting of mother and her two children in Northern Ireland dies in hospital
description: Vanessa Whyte, her 14-year-old son James and 13-year-old daughter Sara were shot dead at a property in Maguiresbridge last week.
content:
The suspect in the fatal shooting of a mother and her two children in Northern Ireland has died.
Ian Rutledge, a 43-year-old agricultural worker, had himself suffered a gunshot wound during the attack in the village of Maguiresbridge in County Ferman... [2171 chars]

title: Police officer among four killed in New York office building shooting
description: Officials say the suspect, identified as 27-year-old Shane Tamura, acted alone and died from an "apparent self-inflicted gunshot wound".
content:
Democratic lawmakers send messages to officers and victims
Lawmakers from New York have been posting their messages on social media.

title: Revealed: The scale of cheap Chinese imports flown into UK without paying any tariffs
description: Sky News uncovers the first official estimate of the value of so-called "de minimis" imports into Britain ahead of an official inquiry into whether this legal clause should be allowed to continue.
content:
The scale of cheap Chinese e-commerce imports flown into Britain without paying any tariffs has become clearer following a Sky News investigation into this new multi-billion pound phenomenon.
We have uncovered the first official estimate of the value... [3080 chars]

title: New mortgage affordability rules help UK housing market avoid summer lull
description: Record number of homes for sale has created ‘buyer’s market’ and kept price rises in check, Zoopla report says
content:
The typical summer lull in Britain’s housing market has been avoided amid the availability of bigger home loans fuelling a “buyer’s market”, according to a property website.
Despite the signs of a bustling market, Zoopla said it had halved its house ... [3646 chars]
